page.title: 16Housing, Alcester
page.content: In the last few years there has been a lot of building in the nothern part of Alcester, providing all kinds of homes for all sorts of people. There are houses with plenty of space built for families, and others built for people living alone. Some of these are called "pads" and are very small with a kitchen/livingroom and a bedroom. Mostly young people live in these. There are also houses for people who are only just married or have only one child. These are cheaper to buy than bigger detached houses which take more land. Two-storey flats, bungalows and maisonettes with garages underneath the living area have been built. The flats are not suitable for elderly people, but the bungalows would be. Some houses are privately owned and others are rented from the council.
